data.title: Add smooth scrolling to the ScrollPanelWidget
data.body: It's back!

data.title: Invalidate FrozenActors that donâ€™t have any sprites.

data.title: Pillboxes swallow units on selling
data.body: Just put Tanya in a pillbox and sell it. She will vanish and you can't train a new one.

data.title: Get rid of explicit widget positioning in UI
data.body:
This would require adding support for hbox/vbox-style layout in containers. If this were done, we could get rid of a lot of the junk in the chrome yaml.

data.title: Adjust travis config to update package lists before installing dependencies
Minelayer field selection artifact
data.body:
When selecting the minefield for the minelayer there is a visual artifact when you select the starting point of the field.

For a couple of frames a field is drawn from the upper top/left cell (0,0 maybe?) of the map to the starting point, after few frames the field is drawn from the starting point to where the mouse cursor actually is for selecting the end point.

data.title: Implementation request: Warhead does not damage friendlies.
Improve unit-attack movement
data.body:
This cleans up and reimplements the last bits from #4469.
- Units will now update their path if the unit they are following moves (fixes #4455).
- Units will now move to a valid firing position if their target is inside their minimum range (closes #2923).
- Units will attack from their maximum range (when attacking structures) or one cell closer (when attacking mobile units), instead of running up beside them (fixes #2104).

This will need some careful testing, as a) it potentially affects anything that moves, and b) it has been rebased over a lot of changes, so it may no longer properly fix the things I'm claiming it does.

In particular, I'm not sure whether we had a reason for disabling the cell heuristic in the MoveAdjacentTo path-finding. In most cases we _do_ want to select the nearest adjacent cell, but I may be forgetting some weird corner case.

data.title: Rewrite SyncReport for clarity and performance
data.body:
SyncReport was being a fairly big drain on my tick times so I decided to bite the bullet and rewrite the thing.
- The dynamic code generation is replaced for clarity.
- The costly reflection performed when dumping traits is cached for speed.
- Allocations are reduced significantly by only saving arrays of values when dumping traits.
- I threw in an exception for properties with the sync attribute applied that either were not readable or used index parameters since they can't be dumped.

I tested this by dumping reports from the RA shellmap and this produces identical output (that shellmap is so handy for testing being deterministic and whatnot - best dev feature ever).

data.title: Minor allocation tweaks
data.body:
A handful of small changes to reduce allocations in the main loop.

These were found via profiling, so whilst only small tweaks they should net a nice 2-3% saving in memory allocations each tick. Plus a little CPU too I should think.

data.title: Enter enemy transports
data.body:
Holding ctrl, you can make various weapon-less units (dog, engy, spy, mechanic, hijacker (!), mcv, radar jammer, mobile gap, money truck, minelayer and so on) enter enemy transport ships, helitrans, apcs, phase tanks or rangers.

Also, the hijacker can't hijack transport ships and helitrans (only enter em with ctrl).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2616263-enter-enemy-transports?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.body:
It would fun to watch interesting gameplay footage in a simple gif file. Examples:
http://i.imgur.com/OGNGInm.gif
http://s8.postimg.org/b5isf53xf/ragif.gif

data.title: Show server list until it is confirmed player can join selected server
data.body:
When a selected server is full and no spectators are allowed, the screen quickly switches from server list-->game full dialog-->server list. This looks clumsy. It would be better if the server list stayed on screen and the game full dialog appeared on top of it. So remove the server list from screen only after it is confirmed that the player can join a selected server. And maybe the server list window could be grayed out in the background. Or the game full indicator could be a part of the server list window, instead of a separate dialog.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2614747-show-server-list-until-it-is-confirmed-player-can-join-selected-server?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Change statistics category selector from drop down menu to tabs
data.body: It is cumbersome to switch between different statistics categories using the drop down menu. It would be better if they were organized as tabs.

data.title: Replays broken, cannot view every replay & some replays are not saved at all
data.body:
Title says it all.

I played game, crashed. Tried to view replay, cannot find.

I tried to watch other replays, they just show the starting phase where mcvs are just standing still, doesnt continue even for waiting few mins.

data.title: Aircraft reload slowing in air, fast at field/pad.
data.body:
What if they reload slowly in the air, but you can reload them MUCH faster if you land them at their proper dock?

Like 15-20 seconds for 1 pip in the air, then at the helipad that would be enough time for a full reload.

data.title: Turn team health colors off when in spectator mode
data.body: Team health colors serve no purpose as spectator since everyone has the same health bar colors. So this should be temporarily turned off when in spectator mode.

data.title: Fixed captured C&C command centers giving no new build options
data.body: As described in #2129 and #2187 capturing another factions construction yard or vehicle factory gave no new build options but your own while in the originals you could steal technology. This fixes it for the Tiberian Dawn mod which turned out to be more work than I anticipated. There is still a bug that, the tech tree does not auto-update on capture so you need to redeploy the MCV, but then it works.

data.title: Show what allies are building in production building tooltips
data.body:
This would be helpful to see what allied players are producing. It is already shown that they are producing something using the production progress bars. This would also show what that something actually is.

data.title: Add Mission Objectives menu for mission maps
data.body: When playing single player missions, mission objectives are shown only before game start, it is not possible to read them once the game begins. There should also be a button at the top or in the game menu which shows mission objectives.

data.title: Show statistics for allies during gameplay
data.body:
Why aren't statistics shown during gameplay but only after it's over? The information on the player itself and its allies should be available during the game too. After game ends, statistics about other teams/players would be added.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2603416-show-statistics-for-allies-during-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Battlefield News does not update
data.body: I guess this is because we have shared settings where it dumps the last time it checked, but per mod update news. My C&C mod still shows the initial "Transmission Recieved" placeholder.

data.title: Streamline PerfSample
data.body: Just removing the allocation overhead in PerfSample since it's amenable to it.

data.title: Speed up some loops with Marshal.Copy
data.body:
Switched to Marshal.Copy to speed up creating sheets from file, which should help startup times a tiny bit.

I tested the AsBitmap methods just to ensure the output was the same and they're good as far as I can tell.

I was originally going to include this under #5484 but the conversion threw me off a bit. It wanted to ensure a BGRA order in memory for the bytes, but everywhere else was respecting the machine endianness. (LockBits and Color respect the machine endianness, and everything else that seems to use those methods just appears to go with it). It's only important if you support big-endian machines (since I may have broken something in that case) but I'm running with the assumption you don't. If indeed you don't you can ignore my rambling here.

data.title: Offer user quick restart if settings change
data.body:
Ever been annoyed by those settings in the menu that require a restart? Well I haven't fixed those. But I have added a little dialog to save you some time! That's almost as good right?

![Restart Now?](http://imgur.com/HQJr5fT.png)

Hit the button and the game will be loading again within a second or two.

Doesn't check for mouse-lock in anticipation of #5597 landing.
